title: Makes provisions relating to poll watchers; repealer
summary: Excludes unregistered voters, nonresidents, holders of any elective office and candidates for elective office in an election district from serving as poll watchers in such district.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          910

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. DESTITO, DINOWITZ -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of
         A. COOK, HOOPER -- read once and referred to the Committee on Election
         Law

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in  relation  to  poll  watchers,  and
         repealing certain provisions of such law relating thereto

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 4 of section  8-500  of  the  election  law  is
    2  REPEALED and a new subdivision 4 is added to read as follows:
    3    4. NO PERSON SHALL BE CERTIFIED OR ACT AS A WATCHER WHO:
    4    (A) IS NOT A REGISTERED VOTER; OR
    5    (B)  IS  NOT  A RESIDENT OF THE COUNTY IN WHICH HE SERVES, OR IS NOT A
    6  RESIDENT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK IF HE SERVES WITHIN SUCH CITY; OR
    7    (C) HOLDS ANY ELECTIVE OFFICE; OR
    8    (D) IS A CANDIDATE FOR ANY PUBLIC OFFICE TO BE VOTED FOR BY THE VOTERS
    9  OF THE DISTRICT IN WHICH HE IS TO SERVE.
   10    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01704-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to poll watchers, and repealing certain provisions of such law relating thereto
